title: Dynamical Characterization of Quantum Coherence
abstract:
Quantum coherence, rooted in the superposition nature of quantum mechanics,
is one core quantum resource in quantum technologies. Until now, various
measures, operational interpretations and generalizations about coherence have
been proposed. However, it is still not clear about the role coherence playing
in quantum dynamics. In this work, in terms of unitary evolutions, the effect
of coherence is fully exhibited. Firstly, by introducing the new concept,
average quantum distance, we show that for time-independent Hamiltonians,
quantum coherence is the average evolution speed and vice versa. Secondly,
beyond this average setting, for general cases, we show that how coherence and
Hamiltonians' eigenvalues determine the instantaneous evolution speed together,
where their trade-off is actually the energy uncertainty. Our results
definitely clarify the role coherence playing in quantum systems' dynamics,
correlating quantum resources with quantum dynamics.
